thinking.disposable_income: Near North Side has high disposable income with median income of $121,562 and 58.8% households making over $100,000. This suggests residents can generally absorb higher transportation costs and taxes
thinking.discretionary_consumption: High per capita income ($118,674) indicates substantial discretionary spending. Higher sales tax impact would be notable but manageable given the affluent population
thinking.accessibility: Area has excellent transit access with 45.6% no-vehicle households. Mixed transportation usage: 18.9% transit, 27.6% walk/bike, 23.3% drive. Dense urban area with many transportation options
thinking.decision_rationale:
1. Prioritized policies that improve transit times given high transit/walking population
2. Community can handle higher taxes/fees to fund better service
3. Selected balanced approaches that reduce car congestion while improving transit
4. Considered that many residents don't own cars (45.6%)
5. Higher driver fees acceptable as most driving is discretionary
6. Focused on policies that reduce transit times below 52 minutes
7. Selected options that balance all revenue sources (tax, fare, fees)
